name: Cabbage Soup
description: A hearty cabbage soup topped with day-old dark bread and melted cheese.
ingredients: 1 small head cabbage, cored and coarsely chopped
6 slices day-old dark bread (rye or pumpernickel)
1/4 lb medium-dry cheese (such as Cantal, Edam, or Gruyere), grated
instructions: In a large skillet over medium heat, melt 1/2 tablespoon butter. Add cabbage, onions, salt and pepper.
Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and cook until cabbage has wilted and reduced in volume, 5 or 6 minutes.
Stir and continue to cook another 5 or 6 minutes.
Add vegetable broth and simmer until cabbage is very tender.
Ladle soup into oven-safe bowls. Top with bread slices and grated cheese.
Bake until cheese is melted and bubbly.
